BY SPECIAL GOVERNMENT PLEADER (VACB) SRI.RAJESH A.
THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 07-12-2017,
THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:
STK

ES
2017/KER/49556
B. SUDHEENDRA KUMAR, J.
Crl.M.C. No.7001 of 2017
Dated this the 7 day of December, 2017
ORDER

When the matter has been taken up for hearing, the
learned counsel for the petitioner has requested for
granting permission to withdraw this Crl.M.C. Accordingly,
this Crl.M.C. stands dismissed as withdrawn.

2. However, the learned counsel for the petitioner
has submitted that there was a direction in Annexure-A6
order that the personal presence of the petitioner is to be
dispensed with by the court concerned and the petitioner
need not be compelled to appear now.

3. The petitioner is aged 66 years. The learned
Special Public Prosecutor has submitted that further
investigation will be complete and the supplementary
report will be filed before the court within 30 days from
today. Since the supplementary final report is not yet
filed after completing the further investigation, it is

a S ware
ra
2017/KER/49556
Cri.M.C. No.7001 of 2017
-32%-
directed that the petitioner need not appear before the
court below in C.C.No.9/2009 till the filing of
supplementary final report by the respondent. I! also
direct the court below to give notice to the learned
counsel appearing for the petitioner before that court,
intimating the date on which the petitioner has to appear
before that court, after the filing of the supplementary
final report by the respondent, as the appearance of the
petitioner shall be subject to the result of the further
investigation.
Sd/-
B. SUDHEENDRA KUMAR,
JUDGE
STK
